snippet: Chris Froome maintained his lead on Thursday, but the nearby presence of Armstrong, a disgraced former champion, was called inappropriate by the head of cycling’s governing body.
abstract: International Cycling Union president Brian Cookson, along with several others in sport, criticize Lance Armstrong for appearing at charity bike ride alongside Tour de France, calling it inappropriate; Chris Froome maintains overall lead in race.
lead_paragraph: Chris Froome maintained his lead on Thursday, but the nearby presence of Armstrong, a disgraced former champion, was called inappropriate by the head of cycling’s governing body.

headline.main: Lance Armstrong Bikes Along the Fringe of the Tour, to the Chagrin of Many
headline.print_headline: Armstrong Bikes Along the Fringe of the Tour, to the Chagrin of Many
